comments.body:
Hello ! Yeah like the jukebox in Stardew Valley, you can listen to every musics you had encountered in the game.

Why not a special jukebox that can be found thanks to a villager, or directly in certain villages, or in an other structure.

I like this idea ^^

Yes! This is everything I want.
I 100% agree.
what

I agree greatly, the ability to place plants in pots is an amazing method of home decoration. I would like all minecraft plants to be plantable in pots

Probably incomplete list: Bush, Firefly Bush, short dry grass, tall dry grass, leaf litter, pink petals, wildflowers, Lilypad, big dripleaf, small dripleaf, sweetberries, glowberries, tall fern, grass, tall grass, all 2 tall flowers, carrot, potato, beetroot, wheat
Most flowers and plants should be able to be put in flowerpots.
I agree with this because this will make more decor and i would like this

Some have also recommended making the icon the player's face instead of just a colored dot. I think that's neat but will be hard to see for how small the icons are. I recommend people check out that idea here.
And there most definitely needs to be a way to opt out and turn this feature off, maybe even a server side option.
the coordinates should be above the bar by default

Here is a much cleaner concept by @realzwuwu on twitter:

Of course, you can see a non-vanilla texture pack being used, but the point still stands. Not only is the XP bar almost completely visible, but creators could actually make use of the dots to make custom stylized XP or progress bars with added depth.

Following what I've seen with the others here and thoughts from similar people, I fully agree that either using icons or player heads overlayed on top of, (if opted in) would be better than either replacing the experience bar or over cluttering the player's UI.
Honestly, overlaying on the XP bar is ugly and doesn't really make sense. The XP bar should be for XP.

34423410551693, to upload an image to your comment/post you'll need to make the comment first and then edit it. When you're in the editing interface, just drag your image file over the textbox and it will be attached. You want to do these steps relatively quickly to avoid your post being removed by the auto mod. 

In the meantime, you can support the bug report about not being able to attach images directly without this workaround. The issue is WEB-7625.
Maybe they can make it toggleable via a gamerule or command, or if your holding a compass or map it will apear.

This would be very confusing! XP has nothing to do with player locations, why imply an association? if I was a new player, I would probably mistaken the dots on the bars as the XP levels of other players or something.

I would like to back this please as I have just used the new version of Minecraft and I love the new lighting and water, and I love the player icons as a compass but the current XP needs to be visible at all times in my opinion.

 

Too much hinges on seeing how much you have to the next level; do I venture into this cave? Do I keep mining a little to finish off my level? Do I risk attacking this Creeper?

 

Please know that a lot of us would like this to be as in the concept art provided here. The icons are still clearly visible, the XP bar is also and I think it looks very clean!

 

Cheers <3
This is a good idea but what if the xp bar was darker to look like the locator bar but you knowing how much xp and the icons changing because it looks bad on a xp bar
They should also fall at the same speed as normal particles. (i.e. block breaking, eating, etc.)
I think each tree should have it's own falling leaves, same logic as each tree having it's own leaf blocks
I was just about to post this haha, I'm glad you're getting traction for this!
This is a problem I didn't even notice, but now that I do, it needs to be changed :)
Yeah I hope they didn't stop updating pigs there
Just makes sense.
use brush on muddy pig to clean pig and get mud
I've mentioned it in my other comment, but their texture should either be identical to, or be similar to the texture of the muddy pig found in Minecraft Earth.
MOJANG please see this genius!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Se lançar capivaras, acho que devia ter a mesma coisa
should be the warm variant, spawning in mangrove swamps
But what about the chickens and cows?
Yes, it should behave more like snow. (Even being able to have multiple layers)
leaf piles on more blocks would be so good for city sidewalks and the sort!
Strongly agree

Replying to the first comment

Leaf letter that behave like snow layer is probably not a great idea that much for a bit of reasons
1. Leaf litter is more like a transparent layer, not a full layer like snow. there's no collision and thats great
2. A stacked leaf would look kinda wierd with alot of its transparent parts

All any restriction like this does is take away from the creative potential, which is completely against the idea of Minecraft. Even a block like the Magma Block, where it may make some sense that leaf litter couldn't survive, again I would suggest that it'd simply restrict creativity to not allow it.

In short, I see no benefit, only detriment from restricting where leaf litter can be placed.

the leaf litter could build up the equivalent of a snow layer once it has all 4 tiles filled. making it 4 x 8 = 24 leaf litter for 1 block. each layer could affect the movement efficiency in a negative proportion.

It feels fairly obvious that they reused the code for pink petals to create leaf litter and either neglected to or decided not to lift the placement restrictions. Considering no changes have been made to leaf litter aside from a bug fix, I'm slightly concerned that this was an intentional choice which I hope isn't the case. Leaf litter is just dead leaves, they don't grow from the ground they fall and land wherever, so it having the same placement restrictions as a living plant doesn't make sense
A bit late but WE DID IT!, Enjoy with yall leafs :3
Added!

Multiple of the "collectable mini rocks" could fit into a single block, like sea pickles / turtle eggs / pink petals / wildflowers / leaf litter. To avoid inventory clutter and add utility besides throwing, 4 or 9 of these could be crafted into 1 cobblestone.

I know the rocks in the woods where I live are mossy, whereas rocks in deserts / beaches aren't. I could see a mossy variant in forests that crafts into mossy cobblestone, and a mossless version for dry climates.
I want to throw rocks at my friends
Maybe can be introduced like a one first layer of gravel, and you add 2 thing in one, layers and some "rocks"
I think they should add pebbles to them and treat them like the wild flowers where you can fit up to 4 in a block they would be great for added texture :D NO MORE STONE BUTTONS !!!!!!

YES!

This would add so much detail to builds!
could also be used as ammo for a sling shot.

The pigs could possibly spread mud if they are muddy onto other blocks within the #dirt tag. or possibly a specific block tag for #pig_converts_to_mud. the pig would stop being muddy and the block is converted. the pig could have a chance to get muddy and will stay muddy while on mud blocks or muddy mangrove roots.

Along this new pig that you have proposed, I suggest that all pigs have a rare chance of digging up truffles.  Though, I don't have much of a idea for uses, maybe in food, or it could be used to brew a blindness potions (It's a mushroom, they like the dark?) so if you like this idea, vote it up and comment, what you think the best use for a truffle is, below.
Muddy pigs should preferably also use a design identical to, or similar to the Muddy Pig found in Minecraft Earth:
GÊNIO
dude i almost lost my mind when i saw that white sheep where gonna be outnumbered. thats the number 1 most common sheep irl so realism excuses here dont work.
I think it's fine.

The pink sheep has always been iconic as the "rare sheep," so adding colors other than white, brown, gray, or black seems out of place. Mojang knows some parts of the game are iconic enough that they don't change them, like the shape of diamond ore or the creeper texture, and pink sheep should be unique in that same way.
I think the color changes would be okay if they also gave the sheep different texture/model variants like they did with the other farm animals

Why did this get included, now when I spawn sheep they are mostly going to be one color.

 

Theres going to be nothing but White Sheep, Having them spawn more then the others woulda been fine, but REMOVING them entirely from that Biome?! Im so sick of these go on adventure.. updates... give me SANDBOX Updates!

Since players can already dye sheep themselves, finding unnaturally colored sheep in the wild doesn't encourage exploration like the Pig, Cow, and Chicken variants do. In the absence of updated sheep models for variants, the colors don't encourage exploration, since the player can just make them at home.

With that in mind, why not take this opportunity to keep the neutral, naturalistic colors -- i.e. the traditional white, light grey, grey, black, and brown (and, rarely, pink) -- as they are, while tying the unnatural sheep colors to villages in their respective biomes? That way, landscapes can continue to look more natural -- which the other new mob variants add to -- while still incorporating biome variety and a way to find naturally spawned dyed sheep. Different village types already have distinct bed colors, and this could be a great opportunity to reflect that by populating villages with dyed sheep that match the colors of beds associated with that particular village.

Agreed, it makes the pink sheep feel less special

I'd much rather have sheep variants

I wholly agree, I like the idea of having the natural sheep colors spawn in specific biomes to make it easier to get the wool for a bed in early game and because it seems realistic, and I like the idea of seeing the dyed sheep to introduce players to the concept in game. Adding them to villager pens is a great idea to integrate them (especially if they match bed colors). I don’t like the idea of seeing unnaturally colored sheep spawn regularly in game because it makes the pink one feel less special and just doesn’t make sense.

It happened! Thank you all for voting on my post and leaving your comments!

Make sure to keep leaving your suggestions on here in the future so we can improve our favorite block game! 💖

Yeah, can we go back to the way it used to be: Mostly white sheep, with a few brown and black here and there, and the off chance of a pink sheep? I saw like some cyan sheep and I was instantly thinking that it looked bad in a spruce forest (sorry Mojang).

Yes. Foxes are incredibly diverse across different temperature zones. The fennec fox is also pretty iconic, recognizable, and cute.

To go along side the vanilla mechanics, the fennec fox could be accompanied by a palm tree--with date palms. Vanilla foxes were introduced with sweet berries, and breed with all berries. The date palm is a berry that fennec foxes feed on in real life. Date palms grow on palm trees, and the palm trees could be sloped to allow the foxes to walk up the trunk to pick the date palms that generate from the underside of palm fronds.
It would be great to have another mushroom, hopefully you could eat it

Truffles may be Sniffed by pigs and make them crazy, put a truffle into a fishing rod do pigs run a lot faster than the normal carrot. Maybe can be used for trading very expensive to the villagers (or the piglings, they are pigs, no?)

As of now, it’s better to choose the dog companion when it comes to truffle hunting. Dogs are more efficient and reliable in finding truffles compared to other methods.

To balance this mechanic and make truffles more valuable in the trading system, only high-level villagers (such as Master-level Farmers or Chefs, if added) should be able to purchase truffles.
Yes! Having these variations of leaf litter would be perfect to enhance the feeling of all biomes! The decaying leaf litter is a bit limiting and looks out of place in a few biomes.
Minecraft should listen to this idea! Though instead of "green leaf litter" changing from biomes, I would like variants like "birch leaf litter" and "oak leaf litter" a lot!
Please do this. It would be fire.
I'd say it should be more golden yellow.

I think they should be more yellow, orange, and reddish colors. Similar to real life. (nothing too saturated tho)
I also believe that there should be more variation in the texture itself.
They should create 3-5 different textures that are similar enough to easily fit together,  and these textures will be applied randomly to each block to simulate the randomness we see irl. (They could be rotated as well to greater improve this effect.)
This would greatly improve the look and feel of the block.

I personally like the brown/orange look for them and would really dislike this change as just this snapshot alone has me thinking of some cool (to me) autumn builds, not exactly timed perfectly since it will be releasing about as far away from autumn as it could but that's not a huge problem
we all love the classic design but this would be a fantastic modification that will help the game looks fresh and more alive
I would love to but people are never encouraged to change the classic.
I think the WHOLE texture is too high definition and detailed. It doesn't fit in.
Yes.32x32 looks out of place.
The texture of the happy ghast itself is also too detailed. It should have the "Giant Pixels" we see on the original Ghast
Completely agreed, and also the happy ghast texture itself too!
100% this needs to happen. I also think that the same should happen for the harness when it is on the ghast. Specifically the carpet of the harness needs to have the detailed creases removed.
some guy apparently made the happy ghast texture but in the resolution of the original ghast on reddit. no reason not to put it in the game.

Looking at the images of the happy ghast it does not seem like it's perfectly scaled to the amount of pixelation a block would have. It's hard to tell, but if I had to guess the happy ghast's main body is 32x32 pixels. The original ghast's main body is 16x16 pixels, which is the same as a block. Given the ghast is 4 blocks tall and wide, having the same pixelation as 1 block just doesn't make sense. Most other mobs, like the zombie, spider, and breeze are all textured in scale with block pixelation. Some of textures of larger mobs such as the whither and guardian are not perfectly scaled. However, these mobs seem to be just slightly scaled up and recolored versions of their smaller counterparts. The ghast has no such excuse and at this point in Minecraft's journey it just looks a little dated.  

All that being said, I personally think the new texture looks quite good. It gives the ghast a polished and updated look while keeping the features of the old texture. I have tried out resource packs in the past that make all mob textures pixel accurate and it was quite easy to get used to. I think the community just needs to give the happy ghast some time. 

BTW, I realize that the original post singles out the harness. However, my argument still stands. The scaling is justified given the sheer size of the mob.

Additionally, for the ghast to be pixel accurate it would need to be 64x64. That would verge on actually being too detailed, so I think the designers hit a good mark with 32x32.
Also I suggest that if you place leaf litter on campfires the way food can be placed on a campfire that it create a taller plume of smoke the way haybales to.

Yes please was excited about leaf litter and this drop until I discovered it could only be placed on nature blocks - I understand why this is the case for the new wild flowers as they sprout from the ground, but I can place leaf blocks above stone bricks and watch how the leaves particles fall down onto them, but I can't place the leaf litter myself? It doesn't make sense to me

Also I most times of year I can go outside and see leaf litter on the pavement or side of the road!

I want to upvote this. I love the new leaf litter block, but one of the very first uses I wanted for it would be as floor litter in tombs and catacombs, but currently it cannot be places on stone, cobblestone, stone bricks, polished andesite, and a variety of other "floor" blocks. Even something like spruce planks on a porch. Would be nice to be able to place leaves anywhere we want (like carpet).
Yes, it's a little unsatisfactory to just let a variety of a specific color generate this variety in a specific biota. We should change some model textures and models for sheep appropriately.

Bighorn-warm

blacknose-cold
Like a torch?
don't you think the grey tone would just... yknow... blend with the rest of the grey in the biome?

You are right, the grey would blend. Two ideas to implement leaf litter: What if Mojang made it so that during a full moon, the pale garden trees would flower. The flower would be orange of course and resemble the shape of the creaking eyes or something similar. With this addition, you could add orange flowers to the leaf litter (As now it will be accurate.), this would break up the monotonous grey and support the addition of pale leaf litter.  Another idea I really like is having the pale leaf litter looking like skeleton leaves, while this doesn't solve the issue of it being grey, these two ideas would make the pale leaf litter unique, interesting as well as preventing it from blending into the grey of the biome. If you think this is a good idea, vote it up.
As of the latest snapshots, you can technically make leaf litter pale by placing it in a pale garden.
Maybe they could walk on powdered snow using the same mechanics as a player using leather boots, which would add functionality / an incentive to pig riding.

Yes! Since Mojang really likes those temperature variants, you could have warm sheep drop less wool and more meat (or no wool and be fat-tailed sheep) and warm sheep have more wool and less meat. They can all be dyed, but you couldn't get wool off of warm sheep without shears.

Absolutely agreed, I think if other farm animals got new variants, then sheep should too! At least they should be given a little bigger and smaller wool coating for cold and warm variants respectively
